title: Fountain - Double Release in July
content:
July 7, 2003 Malmo, Sweden   
   
   
The Fountain catalogue has been updated with the 3 new type families:   
   
 [Alita](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020032220/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/alita.asp) - a text face placed somewhere between renaissance and transitional Antiqua, designed by Peter Hoffmann.   
   
 [Paracelsus](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020032220/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/paracelsus.asp) - a modern take on the old gothic type form called Schwabach, designed by Lars Bergquist.   
   
 [Waldstein](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020032220/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/waldstein.asp) - a Scotch typeface named after young Beethoven's mecenat, this is also designed by Lars Bergquist.   
   
   
We have added a new section to the site called - [Visual Overview](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020032220/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/catalogue_overview.asp) - where you can take a fast peek on our whole collection of typefaces.   
   
   
The second release will be next week when we release 2 new fonts by Martin Fredrikson, plus an update of some of his earlier typefaces.   
   
You can also take a [peek](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020032220/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/catalogue_overview.asp) at some of our upcoming fonts   
   
   
   
have a nice day   
   
Peter Bruhn, principal designer & owner   
 [http://www.fountain.nu/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020032220/http:/www.fountain.nu/)
